column4: Hi, i'm trying to install Ubuntu server 10.10 from a usb stick, and it refuses to load installer components from cd (since there is no cd in the drive). what am i doing wrong? (checked md5 checksums)
how did you create the usb stick?
followed the description on the ubuntu website
That's odd you should not need a cd at all.
nor am i using one. the installer refuses to complete though
what is the exact error you are getting?
Loadd installer components from CD: There was a prmblem reading data from the CD-ROM. Please make sure it is in the drive. If retrying does not work, you should check the integrity of your CD-ROM.
thats a generic error its not actually trying to read from the cdrom its having issues reading the data on the thumb drive.
you said you performed a md5sum on the usb drive?
Something is going on I would recreate the stick using unetbootin or usb creator.
well not on the usb drive, but on the .iso i downloaded
oh you need to perform a check on the usb drive in addition to the iso
let me get you a link
read it carefully you need to specify the size of the iso to the dd comand to get the appropriate amount of data
i'm assuming you will find a mismatch due to your data errors
thanks, i'll be back if i cant figure it out :)
it's pretty straight forward other than they give you a bad example at first and explain why
